sub_title: Senior Project Manager at Embedded Systems Innovation by TNO
summary:
A computer scientist by hearth, a solution thinker by experience, an architect by mindset, seeking for the true sense of the art of system architecting.

Genuine and experienced solution and system architect. Capable of driving complex technical solutions. Able to bridge the gap between (external) stakeholders’ requirements and concrete product realizations. Multiple times taken full end to end responsibility to architecture and develop systems from scratch to customer release. Strongly driven and committed by the operational aspects of complex high-tech industry system design. Highly experienced as technical coordinator for multiple projects and product areas. Able to keep the overview driven from a technical conscience and right focus on quality and verification. Solid experience in coordinating large scale projects set up with multiple distributed agile development and/or verification teams. Able to drive, steer and motivate teams to develop, produce and release within commitment. Experienced in introducing and driving model driven development.

Successfully fulfilled solution, system, product and project management positions.

Qualifications: extremely conscientious, both in delivering results and in being open minded for new ideas and initiatives; team player with strong technical leadership skills; passionate about driving software and solution architecture; experienced scrum driver; strong background in software architecture; customer and time to market focus; release strategies and processes expertise; software version control strategies expertise; coaching; quick learner and swift adapter; good listener; outsourcing expertise; excellent communication and presentation skills; walking the extra mile as a 2nd nature.

school.name: TIAS School for Business and Society

profile_positions.description:
Senior project manager at the Embedded Systems Innovation (ESI) group within TNO, both for B2B cooperations and European research projects. Balancing research objectives against the industrial expectations, closely interacting with the key drivers in the industry and stakeholders in the research community and the academic world. Thereby bringing innovation into real industrial practice, scaling up the impact of the project innovations so that real industry valorization can become a serious consideration.

Main project focus is on (i) governance and methods for systematic multidisciplinary model driven system architecting, (ii) performance engineering research and model-based design techniques, and (iii) exploiting operational data to systematically improve system design and validation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Senior research fellow / integrator at the Embedded Systems Innovation (ESI) group within TNO. Bringing innovation, especially with respect to and model driven system architecting and smart cyber-physical systems, into real industrial practice. Using industrial experience to practice as innovation enabler within, and to boost knowledge valorization for integrated software intensive systems into, the Dutch / Belgian high-tech embedded industry and system architecture community.

Main project focus was on (i) architecting systems for automated consolidated ‘situational understanding’, pursuing the shift from mental to automated reasoning beyond human perception and comprehension, (ii) methods and tools for systematic multidisciplinary model driven system architecting, (iii) methods, techniques and tools for virtual prototyping, and (iv) methods for model driven system engineering.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Overall product area’s technical coordinator responsible for the planning and operational steering from requirement, development and verification up to release for the Ericsson Composition Engine, the next generation Ericsson network service platform. Driver for the product’s life cycle and baseline management, the program’s release strategy, the product’s system anatomy, 3rd party supplier dependencies, customer and support documentation and libraries.

Program’s architects team leader and the product area's system manager. Responsible for, and driving, the business opportunities, architectural improvements and mid- and long-term technical direction and roadmap. 

Daily responsibilities: keeping the full overview on the product area's program as core member of the project management operational steering team, reporting to the program stakeholders, planning and operational execution of all release activities including maintenance and customer emergency releases, in close cooperation with the product owner team steering and supporting approximate 15 development and verification teams (located in the Netherlands, China, India), supporting in customer (tier 2) escalations, internal and external dependency coordination, documentation coordination, bugfix coordination, escalation driver towards external 3rd party suppliers (mainly Oracle), executing architecture studies in close cooperation with local market units.
profile_positions.title: Overall Technical Coordinator & Solution / System Architect

profile_positions.description:
Contributing in introducing modeling as a practical methodology to support the efficient development of correct software systems based on Verum’s ‘Analytical Software Design’ (ASD) modeling and verification tooling. Driver of the Ericsson expert group. Set up a software architecture and development approach in which ASD modeling is used to come to formal verified, so sound, correct and complete software systems. By applying the approach we successfully reach at least twice the development productivity compared to the standard development process for similar complex software systems.

ASD architect, contributing in improving, in cooperation with Verum, the ASD methodology within the telecom domain. Taken up the driver role for further roll-out of the approach within Ericsson global. Given ASD training. Responsible for identifying the right candidate projects and promoting and supporting the approach within these projects.
profile_positions.title: Driver & Architect for Model Driven Software Development

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the program's solution architecture and product management teams realizing an enriched IP-telephony based network solution.

Daily responsibilities: working out business requirements towards the development teams' technical backlogs, steering of 1-2 agile development teams located in India.
profile_positions.title: (Agile) Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Responsible the architecture of a high performance, high available and scalable network service solution. In close cooperation with the customer (a major Italian mobile operator) and the local market unit network architects realizing an end-to-end solution being both generic re-usable and compliant to all the customer specific network, including non-functional, requirements.

Daily responsibilities: setting up and maintaining the system anatomy, project planning based on the system anatomy, steering the local and remote development and verification teams, working out requirements towards backlog user stories, secure technical acceptance by the customer and local market unit.
profile_positions.title: Solution / System Architect

profile_positions.description:
Technical lead and solution responsible, incl. daily operational steering, for the Ericsson Virtual Private Network (VPN) product area. Development of several products bridging services from the real-time telecom domain to the IT (internet) domain using latest JEE technologies.

Daily responsibilities: agile product owner, responsible for the complete product life-cycle from pre-study phase and realization up to the live introduction at first (beta) customers. Coordination of, and direct technical responsible for, all development / verification teams and all technical activities, including 3rd party teams in Poland, Belarus and Mexico (offshoring). Team leader for the solution area architecture team.

Additional activity: process driver for the product area and site-wide projects / products introduction and implementation of a so called "one-track" release strategy aiming at the alignment of roadmap development, customer adaptations and maintenance releases into a single integration, verification and product release track.
profile_positions.title: System Architect

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all technical aspects and decisions focussing on the realization of new releases for the Ericsson Intelligent Network (IN) service platform.

Daily responsibilities: coordination of all external dependencies, all technical communication with internal (such as market units, related development projects) and external parties (such as customization projects, customer service development projects and customers), coordination of up to 6 development and verification teams with associated planning.
profile_positions.title: Technical Coordinator

Lead developer, team leader for several software development and verification teams, troubleshooter, technical configuration manager.

Developing real-time embedded software for telecom. Responsible for the planning, execution and release of new subsystems for the Ericsson Intelligent Network (IN) service platform.
